alert.note: Alert for Mainland Northern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued October 19 at 5:22AM EDT until October 19 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...A southward flowing longshore current, and a low risk of rip currents are expected. * WHERE...Mainland Northern Brevard and Mainland Southern Brevard Counties. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Fresh northerly winds are producing a strong southward flowing longshore current, which can knock swimmers off their feet or into deeper water, making them more susceptible to dangerous rip currents. The longshore current will also increase the risk of rip currents near piers and jetties.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Mainland Northern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard
